node.title: The journey to Cleo Smith being found
node.alt: A sandy camp site with an old campfire visible and tin shacks and a vehicle in the background.
node.description: Police spent 18 days trying to find little Cleo Smith after she disappeared from the remote Blowholes campsite. Here's how the search unfolded.
node.content:
["To\u00a0outsiders, it looks like any other beach\u00a0campsite. You can find them\u00a0scattered along Australia's immense coastline.", "But to locals, the Blowholes is\u00a0a playground.", "It is where\u00a0Ellie Smith and her partner Jake Gliddon spent their childhoods, and where they decided to take their two daughters, Cleo and Isla, for the family's\u00a0first camping trip together.", "They had bought a brand-new tent for the weekend, one big enough for the four of them.", "Over the next two days they were going to teach four-year-old Cleo how to ride her bike without training wheels. They were going to go fishing and play on the beach.", "By the time they arrived at the campgrounds on Friday, October 15, the sun was slipping below the horizon of the Indian Ocean and it was getting dark.", "They pitched the tent, ate dinner and went to bed.", "", "
The remote Blowholes campsite has a\u00a0handful of permanent shacks.(ABC News:\u00a0James Carmody)
", "There were over 100 people at the\u00a0Blowholes Campground that night, but no-one spoke to the Smiths.", "Even in the vast state of Western Australia, the location is remote.", "The campsite is about 50 minutes north of Carnarvon, a small town home to about 5,000 people.\u00a0Carnarvon itself is a 10-hour\u00a0drive north of the state's capital\u00a0Perth.", "There is just one sealed road in and out of the Blowholes.", "Visitors don't need to book, there's no reception or check-in.", "It runs on an honesty system \u2014 campers can leave cash in a box before they go, but not everybody pays.", "", "
The spot where\u00a0Cleo's mother Ellie Smith and her partner Jake Gliddon pitched the family tent.(ABC News: James Carmody)
", "At 1:30am on Saturday, November 16, Cleo woke her mum asking for a drink.", "Ellie gave her some water and checked on seven-month-old Isla, who was sleeping in a cot next to Cleo's mattress.", "She went back\u00a0into the other room, which was separated from the children by a divider, and fell asleep.", "At 6am, Ellie woke to Isla wanting a bottle.", "As she walked into the children's room, she saw the zipper in the tent wall was open. Ellie turned to Jake.", "", "
The Blowholes campground is a popular spot for Carnarvon locals.(ABC News: James Carmody)
", "Ellie and Jake checked outside the tent, but Cleo wasn't there.", "They started looking in all the places\u00a0they went as kids.", "\"Where is she, she needs breakfast,\" Ellie thought.", "Cleo wasn't the sort of child to wander off on her own.", "She would never leave the tent.", "She would never leave them.", "At 6:23am, Ellie called triple-0.", "", "
The remote campsite is surrounded by kilometres of nothing but sun-baked coastal terrain.(ABC News: James Carmody)
", "The first car was dispatched from Carnarvon police station at 6:30am under priority 2 conditions \u2014 lights and sirens, driver can exceed the speed limit.", "The second car left 11 minutes later.", "When the officers arrived at 7:10am, a \"protected forensic area\" was set up around the family tent.", "Another police car was called in within the half-hour.", "At 7:53am, officers requested a drone operator from Geraldton, a small city five hours' drive south.", "Family and friends came to help find Cleo, and SES volunteers were asked to join the search. A helicopter from a local company was sent up to look from above.", "At 8:24am the police incident controller, Inspector Jon Munday, made arrangements to travel to Carnarvon from Geraldton and take command, with a mobile policing facility accompanying him.", "By 8:34am, the road to the Blowholes was shut.", "", "
There is only one sealed road into and out of the remote Blowholes campsite.(ABC News: James Carmody)
", "The alert went out to the public on Facebook just hours later.", "Attached was a picture of the smiling\u00a0preschooler in the exact same jumpsuit she had been wearing.", "It was cropped from a photo taken with her baby sister in matching outfits.", "", "
Cleo Smith.(Supplied: WA Police)
", "\"We're not leaving anything to chance,\"\u00a0Inspector Munday told the media that first\u00a0Sunday.", "SES volunteers spent two days\u00a0sweeping over the scrub like an orange wave, combing for any clues as to where Cleo had gone.", "Detectives from Perth, Carnarvon and Geraldton were\u00a0brought in, along with forensics officers.", "Helicopters, drones\u00a0and an Australian Maritime Safety Authority\u00a0jet provided\u00a0aerial support.", "Off the coast, marine search and rescue volunteers and fisheries officers checked\u00a0nearby waters.", "They were throwing everything they had at the search, and they weren't ruling anything out.", "", "
SES volunteers scoured the land for days to help find any trace of Cleo.(ABC News: James Carmody)
", "Information was handed out to places as far as 1,000 kilometres away from the campsite.", "Dash cam and CCTV footage from roadhouses was examined for potential leads.", "Inspector\u00a0Munday was \"heartened\" by the amount of information coming from the public", "", "
The search for Cleo spanned thousands of kilometres across Western Australia.(ABC News: Mark Bennett)
", "On the Monday after she went missing, police shared more photos of Cleo.", "She was dressed up like a ballerina: her golden tulle skirt matched the gold sequin love heart on her singlet, and her honey blonde hair was in high pigtails tied with yellow elastics.", "", "
Cleo loves princess dresses.(Facebook: Ellie Smith)
", "There were two other pictures.", "A police-branded image of a red and black sleeping bag: the same brand Cleo had been sleeping in.", "The other was of a pink and purple Bonds jumpsuit like the one she had been wearing, laid out flat on a table.", "", "
Police released images of the sleeping bag and jumpsuit Cleo had with her when she disappeared.(Supplied: WA Police)
", "Homicide and major crime squads joined the search effort.", "Police said they were not ruling out the possibility that Cleo had been abducted, but everything was still on the table.", "A few hours of bad weather on Tuesday morning was the only thing that could stop them.", "Shacks were searched, horses brought in to scour the harder-to-reach dunes, and Cleo's face was plastered on missing child posters around town.", "\"We will not leave here until we are satisfied we have searched the area and can walk away with our hand on our heart [that] we have done the best to find Cleo,\" Inspector Munday said.\u00a0", "", "
The Blowholes campsite, about 50 minutes north of Carnarvon.(ABC News: James Carmody)
", "Ellie and Jake had remained at the campsite looking out at the sand dunes, hoping for Cleo to run down and back into their arms.", "On Tuesday, from\u00a0the police command centre at the Blowholes, they sat down for their first television interview, with the ABC.", "Ellie said her daughter was\u00a0\"strong from the day she was born\".", "\"I know she can get through whatever she's going through,\" she said.", "\"She'd be terrified, she'd be so scared.", "\"If you see something, report it.", "", "
Ellie Smith, Cleo's mother, and her partner Jake Gliddon.(ABC News: James Carmody)
", "Five days after Cleo disappeared, police stressed the operation was still, first and foremost, a search and rescue mission.", "But one major\u00a0circumstance was giving them cause for alarm.", "The open zipper on the tent near where she was sleeping was too high for her to reach.", "", "
A missing child\u00a0poster for Cleo Smith at\u00a0a pub in Carnarvon.(ABC News: James Carmody)
", "There were no suspects,\u00a0Inspector Munday said.", "Police had identified and spoken to registered sex offenders in the\u00a0wider Carnarvon area, but played down that part of the investigation.", "DNA swabs were taken from everyone who was at the Blowholes campground on Friday night and Saturday morning.\u00a0", "Yet it was possible people had left before the roadblocks were set up,\u00a0Inspector Munday said.", "", "
The road into the\u00a0Blowholes campsite was closed two hours after Cleo's mother first called triple-0.(ABC News: James Carmody)
", "On Thursday, six days after\u00a0Cleo was last seen by her mother,\u00a0Detective Superintendent Rod Wilde from the Major Crime Division stepped up to speak at police headquarters in Perth.", "He announced he would be leading Task Force RODIA, a special investigation into Cleo's alleged abduction.", "\"Given the information\u00a0we have gleaned from the scene, the fact the search has gone on for this period of time ... that leads us to believe she was taken from the tent,\" he said.", "WA Premier Mark McGowan announced a $1 million reward for information that led to Cleo being found, or to the arrest or conviction of anyone involved in her\u00a0disappearance.", "", "
A week after Cleo disappeared, police had no suspects.(ABC News: James Carmody)
", "For four days, police and the community kept up hope that something would turn up.", "Anyone with CCTV or dash cam footage as far south as Lancelin, eight hours away, was asked to hand it to the task force.", "People in Carnarvon were helping any way they could \u2014\u00a0feeding volunteers,\u00a0making up signs.", "Police had not discounted the possibility Cleo had been taken across state lines, or even overseas.", "Then, on Sunday, a new piece of information came through.", "", "
The empty road leading out of the Blowholes campsite.(ABC News: James Carmody)
", "Two people had been driving north on\u00a0the North West Coastal Highway for work on the Saturday morning Cleo disappeared.", "As they passed the turn-off to the Blowholes at 3:30am they caught a fleeting glimpse of a car.", "It was a passenger vehicle, like a sedan or a wagon.", "It was a lead.", "", "
The car was seen turning right off Blowholes Road and heading south towards Carnarvon.(ABC News: James Carmody)
", "As the investigation entered its second week, police received hundreds of possible sightings of Cleo, but none of them led to the girl being found.", "Officers pulled CCTV from\u00a0an industrial estate on the outskirts of town and asked people to search their sheds and\u00a0old cars.", "", "
The investigation collected thousands of hours of footage.(ABC News:\u00a0James Carmody)
", "Bounty hunters descended on\u00a0Carnarvon, and police warned them not to put themselves in any danger.", "Police searched Ellie and Jake's home, taking pains to stress this was part of standard investigations of this nature. They said there was no evidence anyone had been stalking\u00a0Cleo before her disappearance.", "Another week passed and police still had no suspects.", "The driver of the car that had been seen that morning had\u00a0not come forward.", "Police confirmed they were looking into all alternative routes out of the Blowholes, including a back way out of the campsite at its southern end.", "", "
The Blowholes intersection where the vehicle was seen turning south towards Carnarvon.(ABC News: James Carmody)
", "Another week passed.", "\"Today she's missed Halloween with her family,\" Ellie wrote on Instagram.", "\"Her cousins, aunties uncles nannas and pop but most of all her parents and baby sister.", "\"She needs us and we need her.\"", "Officers were sifting through more than 50 cubic metres of rubbish collected between Geraldton and\u00a0Minilya, a pit stop on the highway north of Carnarvon.", "They were also scouring the dark web for signs of the four-year-old.", "It was gruelling work, but police felt they were getting \"closer and closer\",\u00a0Acting Commissioner Col Blanch said as the search entered its 17th day.", "\"It is difficult to keep the hope up, there is no doubt about it, the longer it goes,\" he said.", "\"But I know those investigators are still focused absolutely on this case, trying to bring Cleo home.\"", "And as the sun set on another day, they pieced together the information they had been looking for.", "It pointed officers to a particular house in\u00a0Carnarvon.", "From the outside there was\u00a0nothing special about it.", "But the dogged, methodical police work that had gone on for more than two weeks led them to believe they were onto something.", "WA Police Commissioner Chris Dawson was briefed by task force detectives.", "They were going in.", "", "
The house in the Brockman area of Carnarvon where Cleo was found.(ABC News)
", "The officers approached the property in the early hours of the morning.", "They broke their way into the locked house.", "One of the four men through the door was\u00a0Detective Senior Sergeant Cameron Blaine.", "He went into one of the rooms and saw a little blonde girl sitting in front of him.", "\"What's your name?\" he asked \u2014 he needed to be sure.", "Another officer jumped in front of him and\u00a0scooped up the child.", "\"What's your name?\" he repeated \u2014 it certainly looked like her.", "She didn't answer.", "But in a house just a few kilometres from the Smiths' family\u00a0home,\u00a0Senior Sergeant Blaine knew they'd finally found her.", "\"What's your name?\" he asked, for the third time.", "She said:", "", "
WA Police released a photo of Cleo Smith in high spirits in hospital after being rescued by police on November 3, 2021.(Supplied: WA Police)
", "Additional reporting by Keane Bourke, Evelyn Manfield, Nicolas Perpitch, David Weber, Rebecca Trigger and Andrea Mayes."]
